ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 3-4 hours
I spent about three hours per week outside the classroom dedicated to this course. My time included weekly readings and preparations for class discussions.
4 hours.
5-10 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: While I see the point of the reading as useful for learning the material and using the class as lecture, I would have liked to have had more opportunities to discuss them. I was expecting it to be more of a seminar style course. But I understand this would have been difficult with the number of people in the class.
By far my favorite class at YSPH so far. Similar to Marney's class, but I feel like I learned a lot more.

This course gives a great overview of mental health issues in general and social and cultural factors that influence these issues in particular. It gives also a possibility to explore more in-depth the topics that represent the major interests.
The course lectures were very interesting and generated good discussions. Sometimes classes were rushed. If possible, this course could meet twice a week.
It's an excellent overview course.
I really loved this course. All of the lectures were interesting and I learned a lot in this course.

Overall, this was a great course in terms of the volume of information one learns. However, the information was very dense and a lot of material was covered per lecture. It was very difficult to absorb all this informatio at once. It would be better if the material was explanined more thoroughly, rather than having it covered at such a quick pace.
Loved how the lectures ended up being very discussion-based....everyone who wanted to share their thoughts was able to.

The mental health course by Dr. Smith is currently the only mental health class at YSPH and one of the most interesting electives I have had the chance to take. The assignments, lessons and class formats were all conducive to our understanding of concepts, focusing on those aspects of mental health we found most interesting. The only potential improvement for this class would be allowing it to extend into more detailed subsections in additional courses.
Great course to combine mental health and public health.

This course was a very good introduction into mental illness and mental health in the U.S. I really appreciate the two homework assignments that were given. Even though they were both on different subjects they allowed me to reflect on the concepts we had covered in class and to really understand how those concepts apply to real world situations. The in-class activities were also very useful and allowed us to think and apply what we had learned in class to real life situations. The student presentations and the guest speakers were also very great.

This course was a wonderful introduction to factors involved in mental health and illness. The weekly readings were well-chosen, and the class discussions were stimulating and relevant in thinking about practical points of entry for public health. There was a good mix of lecturing, discussion, and student presentations. The course could be improved by creating a greater emphasis on the final paper throughout the semester.
Favorite class this semester; incredibly thought provoking; loved the topics

Strengths include a variety of in-class teaching techniques (lecture, group activities, movies, special guest lecturers) and assignments that promote useful public health skills (presentations, critical reading and discussions).

I enjoyed the course a lot. Mental Health was not something I had a lot of information about before starting YSPH, but I feel I have left this class with a better understanding. Lectures were very interesting, and it was nice to be able to cater assignments to our individual interests. It was a great elective class that I am very happy haven taken.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Instructor provided thoughtful and useful comments on all assignments, was great at facilitating discussion and responded promptly to student questions via email.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Megan was excellent, no improvements.

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  The instructor is wonderful! Very interesting and informative lectures, good variety of topics, engaging assignments with rather flexible choice of topics that allow to implement creativity.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Dr. Smith gave interesting and well-planned lectures. Assignments were also very thought-provoking.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Megan is wonderful - she is straightforward and well organized and clear. She cares about these issues and she is always respectful of students. She's fantastic.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Dr. Smith is a great instructor. Very approachable and helpful.

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Megan Smith is a great professor. She was very understanding and would arrange to meet with students outside of class. She was also very responsive to e-mails and tried her best to clarify concepts.However, she does tend to talk a bit quickly and cram a lot of information into one lecture. I think depth over breadth is better.

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Love Megan's balance of professionalism with approachability. Clearly very knowledgeable about this material, and conveyed it in a way that was understandable to those who didn't have prior experience with mental health.

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Dr. Smith was an incredibly helpful and supportive resource. She allowed us for individual meeting time to learn of our preferences, and has been an excellent source of information in my search for additional courses/research experiences in the subject.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Great teacher! Great teaching scheduel. Care about student.

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Dr Smith is a wonderful professor and an excellent teacher. She did a great job teaching the various topics we covered and she made sure to keep the class engaged as we went along. She was very good at answering questions that students may have and she always encouraged us to think critically through the materials we had read.

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Dr. Megan Smith is an excellent professor. She was always well-prepared and did a good job structuring the class discussions and group activities. She was very accommodating in meeting with students outside of class, she was sensitive to students' backgrounds, and she provided valuable feedback on assignments. Class was very interesting and informative, and I looked forward to attending class every week.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Fabulous
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Great professor with a lot of knowledge in the field.

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Instructor is very knowledgeable about content and was very accessible by email and for in-person meetings. It would be helpful to have lecture notes available before class.

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Megan was great. I enjoyed her lecture style and having the ability to participate in class! Megan was a very informative lecturer, and I enjoyed the structure of the lectures. We always knew what to expect as students! Megan invited students to ask questions about assignments at her office hours, and I feel like, because of that, I got to know her better than my other professors.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Pavita Singh  TA was very helpful and promptly answered questions via email. Facilitated useful student discussion.
Instructor: Pavita Singh  Pavita was great too.
Instructor: Pavita Singh  I didn't communicate with TA in person.
Instructor: Pavita Singh  Pavita was very enthusiastic, and quickly and thoroughly responded to any questions.
Instructor: Pavita Singh  I was not a fan of the assignment emails that came in unexpectedly but otherwise she was great.
Instructor: Pavita Singh  Pavita was a great TA- she was very approachable and willing to help students.
Instructor: Pavita Singh  Pavita was a great TA! She would send out reminders and help on assignments.
Instructor: Pavita Singh  Very attentive- great job!
Instructor: Pavita Singh  Pavita is incredibly helpful and knowledgeable and always willing to answer any question and provide each student with individualized help when and if needed.
Instructor: Pavita Singh  Able to answer questions asked by students.

Instructor: Pavita Singh  Pavita is a great TA and she is very patient with us students. She responds promptly to questions we have and provides very good feedback on our work. She also did an excellent job leading the class when Dr. Smith was away and gave a great presentation on the work she does with the Sikh coalition.
Instructor: Pavita Singh  Pavita Singh did a great job as a TA. She effectively communicated with students in and outside of the classroom and added valuable insights when relevant.
Instructor: Pavita Singh  Great!
Instructor: Pavita Singh  Great TA in all ways .
Instructor: Pavita Singh  TA was also very accessible by email and for in-person meetings, and was very helpful.
Instructor: Pavita Singh  Pavita was great. She did a nice job leading lectures when called upon, and she was very responsive to emails with questions about assignments.
Instructor: Pavita Singh  supportive

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Would def recommend this course.
Great course for those who are interested in mental health and its relation to public health.
I would definitely recommend this course to students interested in either mental health or health disparities.
I would highly recommend this course to other students - and in fact it was highly recommended to me.
This course was great and I would definitely recommend it to other students. The material presented was very interesting and I learned a lot from this course.
DEFINITELY take this class if you are looking for a different classroom experience and have even a slight interest in mental health!

A fantastic introductory course to the cultural perceptions on mental health spanning age groups, socioeconomic disparities, subcultures. Although the course has an excellent didactic component led by Dr. Smith and Pavita, students have the opportunity to teach each other through the different modules, allowing for the course to be interactive and empowering.
If you are interested in mental health, it's recommended!
Yes I would highly recommend this class to a fellow student

This course examines ways in which factors like race/ethnicity, gender, SES, and childhood affect mental health. Topics including disparities, stigma, and public health interventions are discussed. I would definitely recommend the course because it is well-taught and practical in thinking about points of entry for public health.
Would recommend this to all students
This is a great course to learn more about mental health.

This course is a great introduction to mental health. I would recommend this class to anyone with an interest in the discipline. I came away from the course with a lot of good lessons, and mental health is something I hope to learn more about through my time at YSPH. Mental Health is a vitally critical component of public health, and this point was made abundantly clear throughout this course.
